Articles.Content:
I could not figure out the new sub-assembly module, are there any good how-to's for .22 out there.?

I did general searches and all I get is the old sub-assembly mod. I am however able to create a single part sub-assembly, but for some reason cannot save multiple part subs. And then, I saved my single part SNAFU in the spaceplane hangar, then went to the VAB to attach it for kicks, yet it was not available, as if I had no sub-assembly parts. Any help????

1. Build a rocket, lets say, and any part below your root capsule or probe body can be taken into the sub-assembly slot in the VAB, then save it as what ever you like to call it. THEN

2. Go back to the sub-assembly location, click on your part you just saved, and voila you have a sub-assembly ready to roll

3. to your VAB-SPH thing, I think you need to copy from 1 sub-assembly location into the other, VAB into SPH and other way around. I do hope this helps you out I just came off a huge mission, so, I may be fizzed out here lol

1. Build a rocket, lets say, and any part below your root capsule or probe body can be taken into the sub-assembly slot in the VAB, then save it as what ever you like to call it. THEN

2. Go back to the sub-assembly location, click on your part you just saved, and voila you have a sub-assembly ready to roll

3. to your VAB-SPH thing, I think you need to copy from 1 sub-assembly location into the other, VAB into SPH and other way around. I do hope this helps you out I just came off a huge mission, so, I may be fizzed out here lol

Thanks Alamo, that is EXACTLY what I have been attempting, but for some reason cannot actually drag my craft into the slot. It is hard to line up, BUT, I Have done it, so it seems, and the entire craft gets deleted as if it were a part being dragged into the pane. Lost for good, there is no recycle bin to retrieve it.

So I tried again with just on part, a capsule, it worked. SO I added a second part to the capsule, and drug it in and get an error, something like "this part is not available to be saved as a sub-assembly" or something like that. So, I stopped there in hopes someone had a tutorial for .22, NADA.

Hi, for what it's worth I had a dabble and encountered a similar thing, what I found was to make each assembly so that it would accept another one, I had a mid section which I had to remove the engine so it would load in and then I added the engine before assembly, hope this helps?
